DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess clinical safety efficacy dual-axis rotational coronary angiography ( DARCA ) diagnosis coronary artery disease directly compare standard coronary angiography ( SA ) .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Study Dual-axis Rotational Versus Standard Coronary Angiography
DOC.detailed_description: Dual-axis rotational coronary angiography ( DARCA ) develop innovative adaptation rotational angiography ( RA ) , require long coronary injection compare standard coronary angiography ( SA ) . The risk complication contrast agent ( discomfort , warmth , pain , hypotension bradycardia ) increase use DARCA . It remain evaluated whether approach also suitable coronary angiography , especially use patient complex coronary lesion . Previous study reveal promising result , number patient include provide sufficient statistical power allow valid comparison DARCA SA . The purpose study evaluate feasibility , safety , clinical tolerance , hemodynamic effect DARCA comparison well-established SA .
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 year old A clinical indication diagnostic coronary angiography evaluate possible CAD Pregnancy Known allergy iodinate contrast Renal insufficiency ( > 1.5mg/dL ) Cardiogenic shock Acute myocardial infarction within one week Prior coronary artery bypass graft treatment Prior percutaneous coronary intervention treatment
